result.execSummary:
The defendant Montreal L Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 1:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, from bail on deposit, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay. Court did NOT order a DNA sample in this case.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

No contact with Shenquale. M. unless approved by court or agent.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Court allowed for third party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent, and only if approved by Family Court order dated after April 3, 2015.

Batterers intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Cognitive thinking classes.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review.

08-03-2015/ Lindsey Grady
Defendant is non-compliant with conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.                            -

08-18-15/ Lindsey Grady          -
Court amended 08-03-15 order at the request of MCSD to remove case # 15CM611 from the order.
Condition time is ordered ONLY as to case # 14CM4640

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montreal L Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 08-18-15 Court order to remove case # 14CM611 from 08-03-15 Court order imposing condition time
Court signed an AMENDED ORDER as to case 14CM4640, removing condition time on ordered on 8/3/2015 as to this case ONLY.
Reflects 08-03-15 Court order imposing 60 days condition time.

Judge Grady signed the condition time order.  Probation review hearing cancelled.
cab
Signed & Filed, Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions --Domestic Violence Court. 60 DAYS

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Grady
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Montreal L Thomas in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 21 MONTHS, consecutive to everything, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Cognitive Thinking class.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Shenquale. M. unless approved by court or agent.
-Court allowed for third party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent, and only if approved by Family Court order dated after April 3, 2015.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, from bail on deposit, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges are WAIVED due to inability to pay.
-Court did NOT order a DNA sample in this case.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. Comply with no contact order. No firearms/dangerous weapons.

Defendant Montreal L Thomas in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders NO Contact with the victim, except for third party contact for time with the children.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 03, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Montreal L Thomas not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state, the court ordered counts 2 & 3 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case passed for Sentencing.

Defendant Montreal L Thomas in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Bail hearing waived.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case joined with 14CM4640 for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shenquale M.

Defendant Montreal L Thomas in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Montreal L Thomas in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.    Case is adjourned to bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am before Judge Dallet in Br. 40 for Judge Grady Br. 23.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
